page.title: 06VINTAGE VANS IN DIGSWELL
page.content: Malcolm Marsh has a butchers shop in Digswell village. He delivers his meat in restored vintage vans. His hobby of restoring old vehicles began in 1958. With a friend helping, it takes 4 years to restore a van or car. He has 3 vans and 2 cars in a long garage beside his house near his shop. He is restoring a black van at the moment. It is all in pieces. One of his vans started life as a laundry van in Norfolk in 1929; another was a cobblers van in St Albans in 1936. The vans are painted in the same colours of green and white. An agent from London paid Mr Marsh to use photographs of him and his vans for calendars and jigsaw puzzles. I have one of the jigsaws. {RICHARD JACKSON
